intro: Leucopogon oliganthus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and heathers, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open heathlands and is adapted to nutrient-poor environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dark berries as fruit. Leucopogon oliganthus is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in sunny conditions with well-drained soils.
